Today I start a new chapter in my life. I will be retiring from coaching here at Capac. For over 50 years I have been coaching sports from intramural basketball and baseball to High school sports here in Capac. I have met and coached so many great young men and women during that time and Met so many great parents of these young people. I have had the privilege of coaching and working with many good people here in Capac. We’ve had many, many good years and some not so good, but for me they were always rewarding. So with a sad face and many memories I say thank you to all the young men and women I have had the pleasure of working with and say thank you for letting me a part of your lives. I LOVE YOU ALL!

Detroit Symphony Orchestra
May 21 at 11:48 AM ·

Graduation is a rite of passage.

During this pandemic, 34 Detroit Symphony Orchestra musicians came together to create a special, inspired recording of Edward Elgar’s “Pomp and Circumstance.” Unable to gather at Orchestra Hall, we performed and recorded the music in our homes.

This year, five orchestra members have graduating high school seniors:

Ethan Kennedy⁠—son of Kim Kennedy (Acting Concertmaster) and Bryan Kennedy (horn)
Caleb Zheng⁠—son of Han Zheng (viola)
Robin Goldman⁠—daughter of Laurie Goldman (violin)
Nicholas Thompkins⁠—son of Ken Thompkins (Principal Trombone)

Graduates: we are inspired by your dreams, your courage, and your tenacity.

The Detroit Symphony Orchestra salutes the Class of 2020!
